paper.title: An Integral Hierarchy and Diversity Model for Describing Product Family Architecture
paper.abstract: Formal and informal methods for describing software architectures traditionally focus on a systemu0027s components and the interfaces between these components. They assume a design process in which the architect basically defines the architecture of a single product. If variants of this product are required, they are either handled implicitly or are defined at a later stage. Since industrial development processes which result in families of products are becoming increasingly common, there is a need for architectural models and notations in which diversity is modelled as an explicit and integral part of the architecture definition process. We believe that the use of such models can promote the overall optimisation of product families and can facilitate validation of architectural decisions. This paper presents a model which can be used to describe and manage architectures in a number of product family-oriented design processes.
